The first computer "bug" was an actual moth stuck in a relay of the Harvard Mark II computer in 1947.
The first computer programmer was Ada Lovelace, who wrote the first algorithm for Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine in the 1840s.
The first computer mouse was made of wood and had only one button.
The first computer virus was created in 1971 and was called "Creeper."
The first website went live in 1991 and is still online today.
The first computer game was created in 1958 and was called "Tennis for Two."
The first computer keyboard was invented in 1964 and had 84 keys.
The first computer monitor was invented in 1973 and was monochrome.
The first computer hard drive was invented in 1956 and could store 5MB of data.
The first computer mouse was invented in 1964 and was made of wood.
The first computer virus was created in 1971 and was called "Creeper."
The first computer game was created in 1958 and was called "Tennis for Two."
The first computer keyboard was invented in 1964 and had 84 keys.
The first computer monitor was invented in 1973 and was monochrome.

The first computer mouse was invented in 1964 and was made of wood.

The first computer keyboard was invented in 1964 and had 84 keys.
The first computer monitor was invented in 1973 and was monochrome.
